description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Bengaluru Unveiled" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Bengaluru Unveiled

places.generalDescription: Shri Gavi Gangadhareshwara Swamy Devasthana, also known as Gavipuram Cave Temple, is a fascinating example of Indian rock-cut architecture. Dating back to the 16th century and dedicated to Lord Shiva, this temple is renowned for its monolithic sculptures and annual sun illumination phenomenon on Makara Sankranti. The temple's unique location within a natural cave adds to its mystical charm, making it a must-visit destination in Bengaluru.

sources.snippet: Gavipuram Cave Temple, or Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple, is a mystifying (yet explicable) rock-cut architectural marvel. Built in a natural cave in the 1500s, the Lord Shiva temple houses a monolithic-cut idol of the deity. Every year on the day of Makara Sankranti, the evening sunlight spreads over the intricate monolithic sculptures and illuminates the Shiva linga inside.
sources.shortName: A Tour Of Bangalore's Architectural Landmarks

sources.snippet: In addition to being a prominent religious site for Hindus, Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple is also one of the most interesting Bangalore historical places. This brilliantly designed ancient cave temple puts on display one of the finest examples of rock-cut architecture in the country. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva, and the study reveals that the history of the temple traces it back to the 9th Century.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: Also known as the Gavipuram Cave Temple, the Gavi Gangadhareshwara Temple is one of the finest examples of the Indian rock-cut architecture. Constructed in a natural cave in the 16th century, the temple houses a stone monolith of Lord Shiva, who is the presiding deity of the temple. In addition, it also has several monolithic sculptures and pillars.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Historical Places In Bangalore, India - Updated 2024

places.name: Shri Gavi Gangadhareshwara Swamy Temple

reviews.text: Beautiful Shiva temple in a cave. A whole different divine experience. It is near the big bull and Basavesawara temples. Near by to lalbagh botanical gardens. You can plan a trip along with these other temples and Lalbagh. It is said that the shrines determine the time in a day without the need for a clock.

Shri Gavi Gangadhareshwara Swamy Temple, Kempegowda Nagar, Bengaluru is one of the most mystical and ancient temples in the city, steeped in history and divinity. Carved out of natural monolithic rock inside a cave, the temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and holds immense spiritual significance. The moment you step inside, the coolness of the cave and the sacred ambiance instantly evoke a deep sense of peace and reverence.

The temple is particularly famous for a rare astronomical phenomenon where sunlight passes through the temple's precise architecture and illuminates the Shiva Linga inside the cave on Makar Sankranti. This unique occurrence draws thousands of devotees and tourists alike, highlighting the brilliant blend of devotion and science in ancient Indian temple architecture. The serene environment, echoing chants, and the rock-carved idols leave every visitor awestruck.

A visit is incomplete without receiving the Swamy special prasadam - a humble yet divine offering usually comprising pongal, sweet laddus, and occasionally panaka (jaggery water), especially during festivals. The prasadam is served with devotion, and it's believed to carry the blessings of Lord Gangadhareshwara himself. This temple is not just a place of worship; it is a timeless spiritual marvel in the heart of Bengaluru.
K.vinoth

One of the oldest temples of Bangalore. The Pooja was very healing to me. It is a natural cave temple , monolithic stone. You can see traces of GANGA, CHOLAS& VIJAYANAGARA dynasties work all around the temple.

places.address: WHX7+754, 5th Main Rd, Gavipuram Extention, Kempegowda Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004, India

places.generalDescription: UB City is a three-level luxury mall located in the Central Business District of Bengaluru, India. Sprawling over 16 lakh square feet, it consists of four towers housing offices, banks, retail stores, a five-star hotel, serviced apartments, restaurants, lounges, food courts, pubs, cafes and an art gallery. The mall offers high-end shopping with international retailers like Rolex and Louis Vuitton.

sources.snippet: One such example of modern architecture in Bangalore is the UB City. This commercial complex is a perfect example of modern architecture with its glass facades, open spaces, and high-end retail outlets. Another example is the Brigade Gateway Complex, which has residential, commercial, and retail spaces.
sources.shortName: Find the Top Architects in Bangalore to Bring Your Vision to Life

places.name: UB City

reviews.text: I recently visited the mall and it was fantastic experience  and absolutely loved the mall, the mall gives completely luxurious look..the ambiance was super, every aspects was top notch.. the architecture and design is stunning..  most of the brand were there and the product range was impressive ..  the mall outside view also stunning.. overall it was a good experience for me.. highly recommend..

Unlike any other Mall, this mall offers a whole new experience. Firstly it's architecture is literally out of the box. Think of a palace or a mahal you've visited. The biggest one. Now imagine if that had been turned into a mall without major renovations. I went there to eat at Sanchez. Though I had not so great experience with the food, the mall is astounding.

UB City Mall is an absolute treat for the eyes - the architecture, ambience, and overall vibe are just chef's kiss! It's the perfect place to hang out with friends, click some stunning photos, and soak in all the luxury around. Just a heads-up: if you're planning to shop or dine there, make sure your wallet is emotionally and financially prepared üòÇüí∏. That said, you don't need to spend a bomb to enjoy the place - roaming around itself feels fancy enough! Definitely worth a visit if you're in Bangalore.

places.address: 24, Vittal Mallya Rd, KG Halli, D' Souza Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

places.generalDescription: St. Mary's Basilica, Bengaluru, is a Gothic-style Catholic church that was consecrated in 1882 and is located just 2 kilometers from the city center. It is the oldest church in Bangalore, with a history dating back to the 17th century. The church celebrates St. Mary's Feast Day every September, attracting large crowds and spreading an elegant festive atmosphere throughout the city.

sources.snippet: Take a walk through history and spirituality both at once at St Mary's Basilica in Bangalore. Standing tall like a proud symbol of diversity, this church consecrated in 1882 is one of the oldest in the region. The church amasses built in not only Christians but people belonging to all faiths.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

places.name: St. Mary's Basilica, Bengaluru

reviews.text:
St. Mary's Basilica, located in the heart of Shivajinagar, Bengaluru, is the oldest church in the city and holds the distinction of being the only church in Karnataka elevated to the status of a minor basilica.  Its origins trace back to the 17th century when Tamil Christian migrants from Gingee settled in the area and built a thatched chapel known as the "Chapel of Kanikkai Madha."  Over the centuries, the church underwent several transformations, culminating in its consecration in 1882.  In 1973, it was granted the status of a minor basilica by Pope Paul VI, making it the sixth church in India to receive this honor  .

Mass Timings:
St. Mary's Basilica offers daily Masses in multiple languages, catering to the diverse congregation.  Masses are conducted in English, Tamil, Kannada, Konkani, and Malayalam at various times throughout the week.  The basilica also observes special services such as the Divine Mercy Prayer daily at 3:00 PM and Holy Hours on the first Friday of every month from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM  .

Annual Feast:
The basilica is renowned for the St. Mary's Feast, celebrated annually in September.  The festivities commence with a nine-day Novena from August 30th to September 7th, culminating in the grand feast on September 8th, commemorating the Nativity of the Blessed Virgin Mary.  The celebrations include processions, special Masses, and cultural events, drawing thousands of devotees from across the region  .

Visiting Information:
Location: Msgr. F. Noronha Road, Shivajinagar, Bengaluru ‚Äì 560 051

Visiting Hours: The basilica is open daily from early morning until evening.

Accessibility: Easily accessible via public transportation, with the Shivajinagar Bus Terminus nearby and Cubbon Park Metro Station within close proximity

Nestled in the heart of Shivajinagar, St. Mary's Basilica is one of the most peaceful and spiritually uplifting places in Bengaluru. As one of the oldest churches in the city, it holds a deep historical and cultural significance, drawing both the faithful and curious visitors alike.

The Neo-Gothic architecture is striking-tall spires, intricate stained-glass windows, and pointed arches that instantly transport you to another era. The central statue of Mother Mary, seen in the image beautifully adorned in traditional Indian-style robes, radiates grace and serenity. This fusion of local devotion and European design gives the basilica a unique charm.

Despite being located in a bustling area, the church complex remains remarkably peaceful, offering a sacred escape from the noise of the city. The atmosphere is calm and reverent, especially during evening services or quiet weekday visits. You can sit in silence, light a candle, or simply take in the sense of holiness that surrounds the space.

The annual St. Mary's Feast in September is a major event, drawing thousands for its vibrant celebrations, but on regular days, the church maintains its gentle, spiritual aura.

Whether you're religious or not, St. Mary's Basilica is a must-visit for its historical richness, stunning architecture, and the profound sense of peace it offers.

St. Mary's Basilica is truly a serene and spiritual place in the heart of Bengaluru. The architecture is breathtaking with its beautiful stained-glass windows and tall spires that give it a peaceful charm. Inside, the atmosphere is calm and prayerful, offering a perfect space for reflection. The church is also well-maintained, and the annual St. Mary's Feast in September is a sight to experience with its vibrant decorations and devotion. Whether you're visiting for faith, history, or just some quiet time, this Basilica is definitely worth a visit.

places.address: XJM3+QQ3, MF Norrona St, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560051, India

places.generalDescription: Bangalore Palace, situated in Malleshwaram just 3 km from the city center, is a majestic royal palace renowned for its stunning architecture and intricate carvings. With an entry fee of 260rs for Indians and 500rs for NRIs, this historical gem boasts 35 rooms and an open courtyard on the ground floor adorned with granite seats embellished with fluorescent blue ceramic tiles.

sources.snippet: Elaborate towers, embellished doorways, floral motifs and lacquer-ware makes Bangalore Palace a sight to behold. When Chamarajendra Wadiyar X‚Äôs British guardians bought land from educationist Rev. J. Garrett, they were looking to build an unassuming accommodation for the young Maharaja. Four years later, in 1878, a Tudor style palace emerged, which still has the ability to leave visitors wonderstruck.
sources.shortName: A Tour Of Bangalore's Architectural Landmarks

sources.snippet: With its turrets and towers, the iconic Bangalore Palace looks more like an English castle than a Maharaja's residence. Often described as a mini-version of Windsor Castle, the stately palace features Tudor Revival architecture with rising towers and turrets adding to the look. Apart from interesting exhibits, the interior decor includes everything from stained glass windows and old paintings to floral motifs and wood carvings.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

places.name: Bengaluru Palace

reviews.text: The Bengaluru Palace is a real palace where the kings of the  Wadior dynasty lived. It has an entry fee of ‚Çπ270 per head for Indian visitors. It has a huge collection of photographs of the last few kings and queens of the dynasty. They give a free audio guide - a device with headset to listen to the history in every spot of the palace. They have maintained very neatly. Photography and videography are prohibited. One can witness the photo collection, artefacts collection, paintings of significant painters like Raja Ravi varma. Immerse oneself into the rich history and culture of mysore kingdom. Outside the palace a neatly maintained garden is there. There one can click wonderful photos keeping the palace in the backdrop. The place is peaceful, surrounded by trees. Many families, couples, friends and tourists visit this palace daily. If you are in Bengaluru, this palace is a must visit place.

Famous attraction in Bangalore known for it's exterior grandeur and beautifully arranged lawns and gardens. The interior is not worthwhile,only some average courtyard and rooms of the royal family. Exterior is beautiful and well maintained. Entry fee is 270 rupees which is high.

Felt like I was walking inside an old royal house. The building looks grand from outside, good for photos. Inside, it's quiet and old-style, with old furniture, paintings, and halls.

Ticket was rs 270, bit costly for what you see, but okay for a one-time visit. Best part was just sitting outside and enjoying the view.

places.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

places.generalDescription: Vidhana Soudha is a massive and architecturally significant building that houses the state legislative chambers in Bangalore, Karnataka. It is a landmark structure constructed in a neo-Dravidian style, incorporating elements from various historical kingdoms. The building features imposing columns, a central dome topped with a structure resembling the state emblem, and watchtowers. As the seat of the Government of Karnataka, Vidhana Soudha captivates visitors with its grand granite construction and impressive design.

sources.snippet: A brainchild of one Kengal Hanumanthaiah, Vidhana Soudha is arguably the epitome of palatial secretariats in India. Built in 1956, Vidhana Soudha boasts a marvelous blend of Neo-Dravidian and Indo-Saracenic architectural styles. After drawing eclectic inspiration from his travels across several continents, Hanumanthaiah gave Bangalore its symbol of identity in the form of this magnificent structure.
sources.shortName: A Tour Of Bangalore's Architectural Landmarks

sources.snippet: The seat of Karnataka‚Äôs state legislature, Vidhana Soudha stands tall, marking itself as a landmark synonymous with Bangalore. Constructed in a neo-Dravidian style of architecture, the building brings together elements from different erstwhile kingdoms like Chalukya, Hoysala and Vijayanagara. A flight of stairs leading up to an entrance that welcomes you with imposing columns, a central dome topped with a structure similar to the country‚Äôs state emblem, watch towers‚Ä¶these are just some of what you see from the fa√ßade of this popular building.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

sources.snippet: Vidhana Soudha is one of the most symbolically significant buildings in the city, standing as the focal point of the legislative branch of Karnataka. Established in 1956, it is the largest building of its kind in the country - and the credit for its design goes to Kengal Hanumanthaiah. Taking much inspiration from his travels across the world, the structure blends Neo-Dravidian and Indo-Saracenic styles of architecture.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Historical Places In Bangalore, India - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: If you are setting out to explore historical places in Bangalore and its architectural gems, Vidhana Soudha deserves to be on top of your checklist. This magnificent structure designed in Neo-Dravidian style is the seat of the state legislature of Karnataka and was constructed in 1956. Elements from British, Indo-Islamic, and Dravidian architectures can be seen in the design.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: Vidhana Soudha | #4 of 10 Best Historical Places in Bangalore. When we say history, it doesn‚Äôt necessarily have to be one that involves kings and queens and battles and palaces. How about visiting a place that has played an undeniable role in shaping the modern history of Karnataka?
sources.shortName: Top 10 Historical Places in Bangalore in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: Another example is the Vidhana Soudha, which is the seat of the state legislature of Karnataka. The building is designed in a way that reflects the traditional style of architecture in Bangalore. The building has a central dome that is surrounded by four smaller domes.
sources.shortName: Find the Top Architects in Bangalore to Bring Your Vision to Life

places.name: Vidhana Soudha

reviews.text: This impressive building completed in 1956 is the seat of the Karnataka Legislature in Bengaluru, India. It's over 500,000 square feet. It is one of the prominent examples of post-independence architecture in India, it stands as a landmark of Karnataka's identity, architecture, and culture. The building was constructed from grey granite. Interior was designed to reflect dignity and grandeur while showcasing Indian cultural values. High-quality native woods were used extensively throughout.  Wear comfy shoes, take water, wear hat, sunscreen.  Popular with tourists.  Beautiful place. Lots to see. Parking is hard to find.  Great place for photography.

Vidhana Soudha is one of Bangalore's most renowned landmarks, serving as the seat of the Karnataka State Legislature and Secretariat. As a symbol of Karnataka's political and cultural legacy, it exudes elegance, especially when illuminated at night.

While general entry is restricted, visitors can still appreciate its architectural brilliance from the outside, except during select official events. Conveniently situated near Cubbon Park and the Karnataka High Court, it is easily reachable via Namma Metro (Vidhana Soudha station). The lush greenery and well-kept surroundings enhance its charm, making it an excellent spot for sightseeing and photography. Whether you're a resident or a tourist, this iconic monument is an unmissable part of Bangalore's heritage.

Starting from June 1, they open for guided tours. Unfortunately i wasn't able to view guided visit but had a chance to view in night. Seeing the building at night is a special feeling. Kind of mesmerizing than in morning. Also less crowded at nights. No parking space available but good to walk along the pathway from nearby parking. Plan and Have a good visit.

places.address: Dr Ambedkar Rd, Sampangi Rama Nagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

places.generalDescription: Sri Someshwara Swami Temple, located in Bangalore, is an ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It was originally built during the Chola period and later renovated during the Vijayanagara Kingdom and Kempe Gowda II's reign. The temple features intricate carvings of various Hindu deities such as Arunachaleswara, Nanjundeshwara, Kamakshamma, Panchalingeshwara, and Bhimeswara.

sources.snippet: The Old Madiwala Someshwara Temple, the Halasuru Someshwara Temple, the Domlur Chokkanathaswamy temple and Sri Ananda Lingeshwara Temple are some such temples, that are more than 1500 years old and boast of the once glorious empire of the Cholas. People on a historical tour of the city definitely should not skip this one, because the amazing architecture and intricate skills that your history book talked about come to life here. Entry Price: Prior permission required Opening Timings: 09: 00 to 17:00 from Mondays to Fridays
sources.shortName: 10 Historical Places in Bangalore

places.name: Shri Someshwara Swamy Temple, Halasuru

reviews.text:
The Someshwara Swamy Temple in Bangalore is a beautiful blend of spiritual serenity and rich history. Located in Halasuru (Ulsoor), it is one of the oldest temples in the city, dating back to the Chola period. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is an excellent example of Dravidian architecture.

As you enter the temple premises, you're greeted by intricately carved pillars, detailed sculptures, and a peaceful ambiance that immediately calms the mind. The gopuram (entrance tower) is a visual treat, decorated with colorful idols and traditional motifs. Inside, the sanctum houses the Shiva lingam, where devotees can offer prayers and experience a deep sense of devotion.

The temple is well-maintained, and the priests are approachable and helpful. It's not overly crowded on regular days, making it a perfect spot for quiet reflection. During festivals like Maha Shivaratri, the temple comes alive with lights, music, and hundreds of devotees.

Whether you're a devotee, a history lover, or someone seeking a peaceful place in the heart of the city, Someshwara Swamy Temple is a must-visit. It's a timeless spiritual gem amidst the modern bustle of Bangalore.

One of the biggest Temple and Beautiful Temple in Bangalore. It's Architecture is like temple available in rameshwaram. Very Peaceful and provide positive vibes. You can medidate also here. Normal Days It feels empty

I've visited this temple regularly (more or less weekly) between 1965 - 1984. This temple is several centuries old, having been built during the Chola era, for whom Shiva was the most important and powerful deity.
Hot to visit after about forty years. Very nostalgic, though there are several changes.

places.address: Someshwara swamy, Sri, Someshwara Temple Rd, Halasuru, Someshwarpura, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560008, India

places.generalDescription: The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Bangalore is a prestigious business school located in the heart of Bangalore, India. The all-stone grey structure surrounded by greenery was designed by Pritzker Prize-winning architect B.V. Doshi IIM‚ÄìBangalore has an engaging and beautiful campus with quiet pathways, courtyards, and common spaces coming together to create a beautiful environment.

sources.snippet: He designed the Indian Institute of Management in Bangalore, which is considered one of the best business schools in the country. He also designed the Sangath complex in Ahmedabad, which is a perfect example of sustainable architecture.
sources.shortName: Find the Top Architects in Bangalore to Bring Your Vision to Life

places.name: Indian Institute Of Management‚ÄìBangalore (IIM‚ÄìBangalore)

reviews.text:
I had the opportunity to visit IIMB campus for a guided tour by one of its architects Mr Bijoy as part of Bengaluru Hubba.
IIMB celebrated 50 years in 2023. It was established in 1973 in a rented premises. Construction of current campus building started in 1978. Chief architect Dr Balakrishna V Doshi designed and planned it so beautifully. Local granite stone was used to construct the building. He chose the building at the highest point of the 100 acre area and made multiple level drainage system which ensured smooth flow of rainwater without flooding. Mr Doshi was highly inspired by the temples of Tamil Nadu like Madurai Meenakshi temple and Thanjavur Brihadeeshwara temple which have large corridors and pillars. Same has been implemented in IIMB.
IIMB campus building is spacious and well ventilated with many open spaces to get natural light. The campus which now looks like built amidst forest was having just 4 trees when it started. IIMB took assistance of horticultural dept to add greenery and it's now filled with beautiful plants, large trees and plenty of birds. Gardener Mayanna developed and maintains the greenery in the campus. He is working here from 40 years and was called back after retirement for his exceptional work.
IIMB also has a souvenir shop where you can buy t shirts jackets and other stationeries with IIMB logo.

It's a wonderful campus everyone dreams to study. Make the best use of it. I wish I get an opportunity to study here.
‚ÄúLet our study be enlightening‚Äù

I had an incredible experience at the Indian Institute of Management Bengaluru while attending Unmaad 2025!
The campus is stunning, with modern facilities and a vibrant atmosphere. The events were well-organized, showcasing amazing talent from various teams. The interaction with students and faculty was enlightening, and I truly appreciated the warm hospitality. Unmaad was not just an event, it was a celebration of creativity and innovation. Highly recommend visiting IIMB for anyone interested in the dynamic world of management!

The Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore, is renowned for its impressive architecture and sustainable design. The campus is beautifully constructed, with each brick uniquely placed to create a harmonious blend with nature. It stands as a significant landmark in India, reflecting the importance of educational excellence and innovation.

places.address: Bannerghatta Main Rd, opp. to Apollo Hospitals, Sundar Ram Shetty Nagar, Bilekahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

places.generalDescription: Located on the edge of Cubbon Park in Bangalore, the Sheshadri Iyer Memorial Hall is a historic red building that was constructed in 1915 to honor Sir K. Seshadri Iyer, the Dewan of Mysore. This European-style structure houses the State Central Library, which boasts an extensive collection of over 265,000 books including rare volumes and a Braille section.

sources.snippet: Amid the lush greenery of Cubbon Park lies the Seshadri Iyer Memorial Hall, built in commemoration of Sir Kumarapuram Seshadri Iyer, the Diwan of Mysore from 1883 to 1901. The European-style building, characterized by its Tuscan columns, was built in 1915. It was commissioned by Lord Curzon, the then Viceroy of India.
sources.shortName: A Tour Of Bangalore's Architectural Landmarks

sources.snippet: One of the major reasons why this memorial hall is at the top of this list is the rich European style construction of this monument. This historical place in Bangalore was constructed by Lord Curzon, the British Viceroy, in honour of the earnestness and hard work of K.Sheshadri Iyer, who had served as Mysore's Dewan for more than 18 years. Located (Read More)in the central administrative area of Bangalore, Cubbon Park, the building captures special attention for its natural beauty and heritage and the marvellous statue of Sir K. Seshadri Iyer erected here.
sources.shortName: 10 Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: One of those Bangalore historical places that receive huge praise from history lovers visiting the city is Seshadri Iyer Memorial Hall. Exhibiting a fine specimen of European Architecture, the building was built in 1915 to immortalize the memory of the Dewan of Mysore, Sir K. Seshadri Iyer. The building currently houses State Central Library with approximately 2,65,000 books and receives guests in huge numbers all around the year.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: The Seshadri Iyer Memorial Hall was constructed in 1915 in commemoration of Sri K.Seshadri Iyer, who served as the Dewan of the Kingdom of Mysore for 18 years. The hall is home to one of the historic libraries of the country - the State Central Library that houses an extensive and wide-reaching collection, ranging from periodicals to rare volumes. It has more than three lakh books, plus has a separate Braille section.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Historical Places In Bangalore, India - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Seshadri Iyer Memorial Hall | #7 of 10 Best Historical Places in Bangalore. If you are a bibliophile, you will be definitely thrilled to visit the Seshadri Iyer Memorial Hall as the building houses the Seshadri Memorial Library. It boasts a huge collection of around 2.65 lakh books and includes a Braille section as well.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Historical Places in Bangalore in 2024 (Photos)

sources.snippet: The State Central Library showcases everything that we know and love about old-school libraries. Surrounded by the lush Cubbon Park, the bright-red building features elegant pillars, sweeping porticoes, and a circular facade. Inside, you can browse through thousands of books, some of them at least a century old.
sources.shortName: Visit This Historical Buildings In The City

places.name: Sheshadri Iyer Memorial Hall (STATE CENTRAL LIBRARY)

reviews.text: It had various collections of books including fictional as well in English and Hindi. It had travel, history, philosophy, psychology, mathematics, physics, chemistry, management, geography, newspaper editions, magazines, competitive exams, religion, Kannada novels, literature, arts and many more. I literally fell in love with the library and the place was neatly maintained. Its a good place to have a peaceful study session.

Nestled within Cubbon Park, this place is surrounded by greenery and active people.  The library's interior is expansive, housing numerous books on diverse subjects. While I'm not an avid reader, some of the books appear quite old and rare. I even found something that captivated me for an hour. Although sitting here is a unique experience, I feel the place could benefit from some additional maintenance, such as dusting and furniture repair.  Many people, mostly students, were seated and taking notes. Two floors are filled with books.

A beautiful red building nestled inside Cubbon Park, perfect for book lovers and history buffs. The architecture is stunning, and the library has a huge collection of books, including rare and old ones. Peaceful spot to read or just enjoy the surroundings. A gem for readers and architecture lovers. The library is spacious, peaceful, and surrounded by greenery perfect escape from the city buzz.
Historic and serene. The bright red structure and calm surroundings make it a great place to relax, read, or take a quiet walk.

places.address: Cubbon Park Rd, near Ambedkar Veedhi, Nunegundlapalli, Sampangi Rama Nagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

places.generalDescription: Byg Brewski Brewing Company is a sleek and modern microbrewery located in South Bangalore, offering a tranquil ambiance with outdoor seating beside a koi pond. The brewery provides an amazing view of the city and serves delicious continental food along with freshly brewed beer. With its rooftop setting, pleasant weather, and excellent service, it's considered one of the most beautiful breweries in Bangalore. The staff is welcoming, and the poolside seating adds to the enticing experience.

sources.snippet: Touted to be the country‚Äôs largest microbrewery (although we seem to have new competitors now), Byg Brewski‚Äôs Hennur outlet is an architectural beauty to look out for. Spread across a whopping 65,000 sq. ft, the brewery feels like a mini-city in itself.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

places.name: Byg Brewski Brewing Company

reviews.text:
Had a great time at Byg Brewski! The place has a lively vibe, and even though it was quite packed, I got a table quickly since it was a weekday.

The brew beer was really good - fresh and just right. Starters were the highlight for me, with a lot of variety to choose from. I tried the fried chicken and pork sliders, and both were super tasty.

They also had some fun activities and events going on, which kept the energy up. Music added to the overall vibe and made the evening even better.

Loved the atmosphere and the food. Would definitely visit again!

One thing that I'd love to see here - My fav apple cider üòÜ

One of best brewery experience we had so far in Bengaluru. Food was awesome. Special mention are cilantro chicken and pork bao. Service was execellent and timely. They were serving multiple dishes with few gap in between so we could enjoy all and never been in a hurry. Food price also was very reasonable compared to other breweries in Sarjapura. Beer and other liquor options are quite good and taste of craft beer also good. Ambience wise it was simple but shoothing. Pond side seating was very good experience. Will definitely look forward too go back again.

I recently visited this place and was truly impressed. The food was delicious. Every dish felt thoughtfully prepared, and the menu had a great variety to choose from.

What really stood out was the ambience-cozy, well-lit, and perfect for both casual outings and special dinners. Whether you're catching up with friends or looking for a quiet dinner, this spot hits the mark!!

places.address: 10/62/2A/2 & 3, Sarjapur Main Rd, behind MK Retail, near WIpro Corporate Office, Kaikondrahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560035, India

places.generalDescription: C.S.I St. Andrew's Church, also known as St. Andrews Church or St. Andrews KIRK, is a Presbyterian church in Bangalore with Gothic architecture and stunning stained glass work. Built between 1864 and 1866, it was named after St. Andrew, the patron saint of Scotland. The church features turrets, gables, parapets, crested towers, and more in its imposing Gothic structure.

sources.snippet: Consecrated in 1866, St. Andrew‚Äôs Church (it was called St. Andrew‚Äôs Kirk then) that belonged to the Church of Scotland. It took two years to build this beauty at a cost of Rs 45,000 (you can‚Äôt even get an iPhone X for that much these days). Apart from the soaring belfry, the church‚Äôs stained-glass windows are worth poring over.
sources.shortName: Visit This Historical Buildings In The City

places.name: C.S.I St. Andrew's Church

reviews.text: Amazing church ..well maintained. One of ancient church of Bangalore.

Really really beautiful church near church street ......
Love the different architecture of this place and truely adore the beautiful glass-art inside the church .....
I espically like the slanting roof of the place , gives a lot of Irish vibes .....
There's no proper timings displayed as such,  just the timings of prayers and mass have been shown ....so make sure you visit this place during mass-timings .... The timings shown in Google maps is not that accurate and the security ppl may shoo you off if you go at odd timings .... if you request them , they will allow you to see the church....but am not sure how open they will be -_-
So visit it during prayer timings!
I went here on Saturday at around 3.....
The front door was closed but I could go inside from the side-doors .nobody was present inside at the time except for few church caretakers who were cleaning and propping up the place for evening prayer...
A security guard later came up to me to inform me that taking photos was prohibited all throughout the church grounds !!.... but anyways....there was no signage that says - no photography allowed ! , so I had already taken couple of photos :)
Reaching this place is easy as it's very much beside the mainroad itself and metro is nearby ( need to walk a little but it's manageable)
The place is very aesthetic with lots of focus on fine details .... The surroundings are filled with plants and is well maintained ....
Overall, I loved the fine details like the rows of hanging potted plants everywhere (even inside the church! ...you can see them trailing down near the glass piece) , Bible books kept at every isle, classy glowing round lights, the clock tower,  the coloured tinted glasses and obviously the very artfull glasswork which is soo majestic! Love it :)))))

An historical landmark in the town with over 150+ years old. It's built in a gothic structure architecture.

Sadly we were reached there a little late due to heavy traffic. So it was closed already.

The security people neither allowed us to visit the premises nor to take any photos.

places.generalDescription: The National Gallery of Modern Arts (Bengaluru) is a sprawling museum established in 2009 within the heritage Manikyavelu Mansions. It is part of a trio of galleries set up by the Indian Ministry of Culture to showcase the historical significance and heritage of Indian art dating back to the 18th century.

sources.snippet: With its impressive collection of paintings, sculptures and prints across different periods, the NGMA in Bangalore is a popular spot for art and culture enthusiasts in the ooru. However, if you‚Äôre someone who appreciates architecture, the structure has much for you to admire as well. When the 100-year-old Manikyavelu mansion was converted into the art gallery, the team at INTACH (the folks behind the refurbishing project) wanted to ensure it brought together the heritage of the structure and the modern elements of an art space.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

sources.snippet: National Gallery of Modern Art Bangalore inaugurated in 2009 houses more than 14000 implausible works of art from various famous artists like Rabindranath Tagore, Jamini Roy, Raja Ravi Verma and many more. It is a perfect blend of art dating back to the 18th Century to a modern piece of work which showcases the cultural roots of India with passing time through many variations. This gallery also hosts many workshops, educational tours, seminars, talks all related to art and culture which represents India.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

places.name: National Gallery of Modern Art (Bengaluru)

reviews.text:
Visited on a weekend and found the place peaceful and inspiring. The entry fee was just Rs.20 with no waiting time. Each artwork tells a unique story and details about the artists are provided beside every piece.

I especially loved the Braille section, such a beautiful and inclusive idea. Photography of the artwork and interiors is allowed though personal photos inside the gallery are not permitted. There's a lovely outdoor space for pictures and a cozy caf√© to unwind.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a calm, enriching day out in Bangalore.

A well maintained National museum located in prime area of the city.
Visited on a weekend entry fee was 20 rs only.
The place is peaceful with lush greenary. There is a variety of paintings and artwork. The paintings reflect various situations and themes that are on based, society, culture, history etc.
Overall I liked the experience and would recommend art lovers to visit

Tucked right in the middle of the city, yet far away from all its chaos, this place is pure calm. The lush trees, shrubs, and blooming flowers make you feel like you've stepped into a little oasis. The entry fee for Indians is just ‚Çπ20 ‚Äì a small price for the peace and beauty you'll find here.

Once inside, you'll be asked to leave your bags at the store near the entrance and collect a token. The main art gallery sits in a charming old building that itself feels like a piece of history. The ground floor is home to the incredible works of the legendary Nandalal Bose, while the upper floors are filled with artworks that truly stop you in your tracks ‚Äì acrylics, watercolours, oils, mixed media, ink, and pencil sketches, all beautifully displayed.

The building's design, its thoughtful upkeep, and the warm politeness of the staff deserve a special mention. Practical touches like the lift, auditorium, washrooms, and a small cafeteria on the ground floor make the visit even smoother.

places.generalDescription: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace is an opulent residence that belonged to the 18th century ruler, Tipu Sultan. The palace boasts picturesque grounds and a captivating historical exhibition. Designed by Tipu Sultan's son, the gardens are reminiscent of the stunning landscapes in Sira, Karnataka. The palace is adorned with exotic flowers and trees imported from various countries, making it a haven for rare bird species like Myna and Brahminy kites.

sources.snippet: Tipu Sultan (1750-1799) went down in history as a hero, and is known as the Tiger of Mysore. He also had a penchant for grand architecture, reflected in his summer palace, ‚ÄòRash-e-Jannat‚Äô or ‚ÄòEnvy of the Heavens‚Äô. Predominantly constructed using teak wood, Tipu Sultan‚Äôs Summer Palace is decorated with meticulous motifs, and is a visual treat.
sources.shortName: A Tour Of Bangalore's Architectural Landmarks

sources.snippet: This exquisite royal palace tops the list of historical places in Bangalore. One of the finest examples of Indo-Islamic architecture in Bangalore, Tipu Sultan‚Äôs Summer Palace served as the summer residence of Tipu Sultan, the ruler of the Kingdom of Mysore. Like other Indo-Islamic buildings in different parts of the country, the ceilings and walls of the palace feature beautiful floral patterns and the arches display an intricate design.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: Situated in the center of Old Bangalore, Tipu Sultan‚Äôs Summer Palace was first built in 1537 by Kempe Gowda (Bangalore‚Äôs founding father) with mud bricks. Later it was modified and rebuilt by Mysore ruler Hyder Ali and finished by his son Tipu Sultan in 1791. It is a two-story palace and is predominantly made of teak.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Historical Places In Bangalore, India - Updated 2024

places.name: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace

reviews.text:
Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace in Bangalore is a must-visit destination for history buffs and architecture enthusiasts. This 18th-century palace, built in 1791, served as the summer retreat for Tipu Sultan, the ruler of Mysore. Here's what you can expect:

*Architecture and Features:*

- The palace is a beautiful example of Indo-Islamic architecture, with teak pillars, arches, and balconies.
- The two-storey structure has a stone plinth and wooden beams, with intricate carvings and floral motifs.
- The upper level has an open balcony area with projecting balconies where Tipu Sultan would hold court.

*Things to See and Do:*

- Explore the museum on the ground floor, showcasing Tipu Sultan's belongings, including his clothes, crown, and weapons.
- See the replica of Tipu's tiger, a mechanical tiger that symbolizes his victory over the British.
- Visit the durbar hall on the first floor, where Tipu Sultan would hold court, and admire the Zenana quarters, the private rooms for the royal ladies.
- Take a stroll in the well-manicured gardens and lawns in front of the palace ¬π ¬≤.

*Practical Information:*

- *Timings:* 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM, daily
- *Nearest Metro Station:* KR Market Metro Station
- *Getting There:* Take a cab or auto ride, as parking can be a hassle

*Tips:*

- Spend 1-2 hours exploring the palace and its surroundings.
- Consider a guided tour for a more in-depth understanding of the palace's history and architecture.
- Visit the nearby Bangalore Fort and Venkateswara Temple to make the most of your trip

Overall, Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace is a great place to visit if you're interested in history, architecture, or simply want to experience the city's cultural heritage.

Small but well detailed.
One can start with a nominal fees of 20 rupees. Ticket buying process is just online, no offline mode available. One can easily spend an hour or two. Clicking pictures is allowed majorly except in some restricted areas. Walking and climbing stairs, no lift facility available so elders should be mindful of that.
Picturesque Ambience.
Nearby is the tipu sultan fort so both can be viewed in one go. Advised to visit with friends and family for history enthusiasts.

Just visited Tippu Sultan's Summer Palace in Bangalore and it was amazing! The palace is steeped in history and the architecture is stunning. The intricate carvings, ornate pillars, and beautifully designed arches are a must-see. A great place to learn about the region's rich cultural heritage. Recommend! üòäüëç

sources.snippet: Residential architecture in India is a direct reflection of the ethnic practices and lifestyles led by its diverse citizens. The earliest houses were developed as units of larger community-centric settlements. The architecture of Indian residences is deeply enmeshed with cultural values - usually centering on the ideas of family and community relationships.

reviews.text:
Went for Beyond bangla by Chef Auroni Mookherjee. Outstanding epecurian experience. His rendition of popular Bengali favourites like the seafood dabchigri, the lamb ravioli in mangsho jhol style and tangra style ramen were outstanding! Tried the kachagolla with spice honey for dessert - divine

Thank you Chef Auroni, Chef Anushka & team !!

The food and service was good. Liked the harissa chicken sandwich, and the veg grilled sandwich. The South Indian filter coffee with jaggery syrup was also good.

What I find very odd is the parking charges of 200 bucks - esp when the car is parked right in front of their property. This is quite bizarre when the valet parks the car either in front or in their basement.

I'd say it's a Small yet a sophisticated space.
Had a good time watching the sangeeth scene there.
The mood was totally poetic with the rain, traditional music and hot chocolate. We've entered when the music was playing and it slowly started drizzling. We sat there trying food from Ajji house while completely immersed in the music

Top 20 Architects in Bangalore, Karnataka, India

places.name: Kamat & Rozario Architecture

reviews.text:
Our apartment in Bengaluru was remodeled by Kamat and Rozario. Saying 'remodeled' is an understatement because the house feels and looks out of the world. Mr. Lester was involved from day 1. We were always of the view that 'form follows the function' giving more importance to usability and maintenance while keeping the aesthetics in mind. We were very impressed when the team showed us the design and we were eager to start the work.

Their contractor Mr Satish Sharma has an excellent team. They were very particular about process they followed and their workmanship was superb. This house is in single tower high-rise building, which has its own challenges in terms of material movements, noise and dust. However the team took a great care of all these aspects and I never had any complaint from the neighbors or association. We had to relook into few aspects of design during the execution and team was very willing to make the changes and accept our suggestions.

At the end of the project the house was transformed into a totally a different house. Our guests always in awe and wonder if this apartment is really part of this building. Thank you Lester and team. Your approach to the work is very professional and customer centric. We are very much delighted!

Kamat & Rozario Architecture is a multi-disciplinary design studio based in Bangalore, India. They offer services in architecture, interior design, and furniture design. The firm has won several awards and has been featured in various publications. They have completed six projects, including residential and educational architecture, as well as interior design. Kamat & Rozario Architecture is considered one of the best architects in Bangalore.

Some of their notable projects include:
#Corbel House
#White Canvas
#Pitched House
#22 Feet
#Ananya Technologies
#Stirred Creative

Checkout thier video -
https://youtu.be/_DuMhw7ympc?si=YxxKRl2ZJCA4dWoy

Lester Rozario is a amazing person. Takes the client brief  seriously. Gives patient hearing and open to suggestion. He has conceptualised and ensured a dream home for us. It didn't end there. He accompanied us  to various nurseries and helped us to select the appropriate plants. I recommend Lester & Smruti to those who want personalised abodes no matter what the constraint is.

places.generalDescription: The World Trade Center in Bangalore stands as a remarkable architectural feat, soaring high with over 50 floors and offering breathtaking views of the cityscape. Nestled within the Brigade Gateway Campus, this iconic structure is not only a hub for businesses like Amazon but also provides an inviting atmosphere for visitors. The nearby Orion Mall adds to the vibrancy of the area, while the serene artificial lake offers a perfect spot to unwind with a warm beverage after exploring.

sources.snippet: If you've passed through Malleshwaram or nearby hood, chances are that you've spotted this sleek structure dominating the city's landscape. Standing at a whopping 128 m, Bangalore's World Trade Center was the tallest building in the city earlier. Housing offices of international giants like Amazon, organisations and even hotspots like High Ultra Lounge, the structure is a hub of commercial activity.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

places.name: World Trade Center

reviews.text: World trade center also known as brigade gateway is an iconic building of Bengaluru and located in the posh location of malleshwara and it is located just beside the Orion mall as well as Isckon temple. The pond infront of building is also very nice and a relaxing space and the building itself houses a lot of companies.

The World Trade Center in Bangalore is a truly unique place, standing tall as a symbol of modern architecture and sophistication. Located in the bustling area of Malleswaram, it offers a world-class environment, making it a prime destination for both businesses and visitors alike.

The towering structure, with its sleek design and high-end facilities, sets a standard for corporate spaces in Bangalore. As soon as you step in, you're greeted by an ambiance of luxury and professionalism, which immediately makes an impression. The quality of infrastructure is top-notch, with state-of-the-art amenities catering to various needs ‚Äì from global business operations to dining and entertainment.

One of the major highlights of the World Trade Center is its proximity to the Orion Mall, which provides a great mix of shopping, dining, and leisure activities. The location is well-connected, making it convenient for professionals and visitors to commute.

The rich environment here is not just in terms of its luxurious surroundings but also in the diverse community of international and national organizations it houses. Whether you're visiting for business or leisure, the World Trade Center Bangalore offers an experience of quality and class. Highly recommended!

Just visited this place on weekend. I don't know how people might be feeling working in that closed building but once you step out of that building it's beautiful to sit outside near that artificial lake and spend evening with a cup of tea or coffee. Such a peaceful place to be.
Though on weekends due to orian mall it becomes crowded but WTC side it's still calm as very less people are there for office on weekends.

places.generalDescription: The Government Museum, located in Bangalore and established in 1865, is one of India's oldest and most popular museums. It attracts over 90,000 visitors annually. The museum features a historic red building and encompasses 18 galleries showcasing a wide array of artifacts including carvings, weaponry, sculptures, textiles, jewelry, coins, inscriptions and paintings dating back to ancient kingdoms such as Tanjore, Deccan and Mysore.

sources.snippet: Undoubtedly one of the most charming buildings in Bangalore, the Government Museum on Kasturba Road, has been around since 1877. Previously, the city‚Äôs museum was part of the Cantonment‚Äôs jail building before it moved to this neoclassical structure that was planned by Col. Richard Hieram Sankey. The stunning red building is taken to the next level with its grand Corinthian columns, graceful balconettes topped with pediments, and doors and windows that have been painted in a soothing green.
sources.shortName: Visit This Historical Buildings In The City

sources.snippet: Government Museum is the second oldest museum in South India which showcases exquisite works of art. Government Museum first opened in a rented building in 1865 and later in 1879 construction of the new building designed by Colonel Sankey was completed which became functional in 1980. Explore the galleries of this hub of knowledge which has a wealth of information pertaining to various sections like ethnology, natural history, architecture, sculpture, etc.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

sources.snippet: Government Museum | #8 of 10 Best Historical Places in Bangalore. Museums are places where you can get glimpses of history through a variety of objects and artifacts. The Government Museum in Bangalore, however, is not only a treasure trove of geological and archaeological artifacts, but also a historical building in itself.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Historical Places in Bangalore in 2024 (Photos)

places.name: Government Museum

reviews.text:
An historic landmark of Bangalore, the heritage of Karnataka. It's one of the oldest museum.

The museum have a good collection of artifacts, archeological finds, sculptures, paintings, ancient guns and swords and stone carvings.

There's an entry fees of approx 20rs per person for the entry. And parking facilities are available.

Also there's small snacks shops available near the gate for refreshing.

Bowring,¬†is one of the oldest museums in India¬†and the second oldest museum in South India.¬†It is now an¬†archaeological museum¬†and has a rare collection of archaeological and geological artifacts including old jewellery, sculpture,¬†coins¬†and¬†inscriptions. The museum is also home to the¬†Halmidi inscription,¬†the earliest¬†Kannada¬†inscription (450 AD).

places.generalDescription: Shri Nandi Swami Temple, also known as Big Bull Mandir, is a famous religious site located in India. The temple is dedicated to Nandi, the sacred bull and vehicle of Lord Shiva. It is adorned with intricate carvings and sculptures, making it a visually stunning attraction for visitors. The temple holds great significance for devotees and offers a peaceful atmosphere for spiritual reflection.

sources.snippet: Big Bull Temple is the biggest and one of the oldest temples in India dedicated to sacred bull Nandi, a devotee of Lord Shiva. An enormous statue carved out on a single granite rock is a spectacular work of art. The imposing statue of the bull is 6 m long and has a height of 4.5 m.
sources.shortName: 20 Best Historical Places in Bangalore

places.name: Shri Nandi Swami Temple (Big Bull Mandir)

reviews.text: A very sacred place and peaceful......It is just beside the Dooda Ganesha Temple.....Located at Baswangudi......Nearby Metro is Lalbagh or National College any one you can choose and just 1.75 kms approx from both the Metro.....20 minutes walking distance.
My lovely place in Bangalore ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüôÇ

Shri Nandi Swami Temple is a serene and spiritually uplifting destination, located atop a picturesque hill. The temple is dedicated to Nandi, the sacred bull of Lord Shiva, and features a massive Nandi sculpture carved from a single rock, showcasing exquisite craftsmanship and deep historical significance.

Experience & Surroundings:
- The climb up to the temple is refreshing, surrounded by lush greenery and a peaceful atmosphere. It's an ideal spot for those looking to escape the chaos of the city and immerse themselves in nature and spirituality.
- The ambience is calm and relaxing, making it perfect for meditation or simply unwinding in the presence of divinity.

Sri Dodda Ganapathi Temple:
At the foot of the hill, you will find Sri Dodda Ganapathi Temple, another must-visit shrine. It is known for its massive Ganapathi idol, which is said to bring prosperity and blessings to devotees.

Final Thoughts:
Whether you are a devotee, nature lover, or history enthusiast, Shri Nandi Swami Temple offers a blend of spirituality, scenic beauty, and peace. A visit here is not just about seeking blessings but also about experiencing tranquility and cultural richness.

places.name: Design Thoughts Architects

reviews.text:
I wanted good design,  safe, functional and aesthetically pleasing while maximising space utilisation, natural light and ventilation. Design Thoughts team supported and guided me well. They discussed well and took our requirements in detailed. We chose their services because of their positive customers feedback, reasonable cost and excellent designs. They provided a  very good drawing in detailed and design.

The team is highly skilled and professional who turned our aspirations into reality. They guided well through the design, planning and construction process. Drawings were very clear and any issue in site the team assisted well.

I was looking for an experienced architect who could convert our ideas into design taking into consideration various aspects of architecture like dimensions, aesthetics, usability and vastu compliance. Team design thought has been able to help us with this requirement.
Their positive reviews and professional approach encouraged me to choose their services, and I'm glad I did. Their stage-wise deliverables approach provided much-needed clarity, helping us understand what to expect at each step of the process.
The team was highly professional, accommodating all our change requests seamlessly. They offered end-to-end support for architecture and design, ensuring a smooth and stress-free experience.

We chose Design Thoughts Architects because of their exceptional ability to turn our vision into reality. The team demonstrated a deep understanding of our needs, offering creative and innovative solutions that perfectly aligned with our goals. From the initial consultation to the final design, they were attentive, responsive, and highly professional. Their expertise in balancing functionality with aesthetic appeal gave us confidence in their ability to manage both the design and the budget effectively. We were particularly impressed with their collaborative approach, making sure every detail was thoughtfully considered while keeping the process seamless and stress-free.

The design ideas provided helped us navigate through the process and manage the budget with ease, making everything much more straightforward and less stressful.

One feature I really liked about their services is the level of detail in the drawings. The clarity and precision in their designs made it easy to understand every aspect of the project, which helped ensure everything was executed exactly as envisioned.

What made us very happy with Design Thought's service was their attention to detail and commitment to understanding our vision. They took the time to listen to our ideas and preferences, and then translated them into a design that exceeded our expectations. The level of professionalism and responsiveness throughout the process was outstanding, and we always felt well-informed and supported. Additionally, their ability to keep the project within budget while maintaining high-quality design was a huge plus. Overall, it was the seamless communication and dedication to delivering exactly what we wanted that made us incredibly happy with their service.

The main reason I would recommend Design Thought's service to others is their clear communication and professional approach. From start to finish, their kept us well-informed at every stage, ensuring we understood the process and were comfortable with all decisions. Their professionalism made the entire experience smooth and stress-free, and we always felt like a priority. This level of transparency and expertise is something I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for reliable and efficient architectural services.

places.address: 259, 17th Cross Rd, opp. Sri Sai pushpanjali kalyana mantapa, 5th Phase, KR Layout, JP Nagar Phase 6, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

places.generalDescription: Infosys Limited, established in 1981, is a global consulting and IT services company with over 250,000 employees. The company's Bangalore campus spans 81 acres and features impressive architectural designs such as a futuristic pyramid and a structure resembling the Sydney Opera House. The campus is known for its well-maintained greenery, providing employees with a refreshing environment to reduce stress.

sources.snippet: Infosys campuses are probably one of the top contenders for architectural gems in cities; it definitely is in Bangalore. Spread across 81 acres, the sprawling campus has a futuristic-looking pyramid dominating the space. When you're done gaping at its shiny exterior, there's another structure modelled after Sydney Opera House and other features that look like they've appeared right out of a sci-fi movie.
sources.shortName: Architectural Marvels Of Bangalore - Best Architectural Buildings of Bangalore

sources.snippet: Mindspace, formed in October 2004, is an architectural firm with extensive experience in handling residences, institutions, research labs and corporate offices. Founded by Sanjay Mohe, Vasuki Prakash and Suryanarayanan, the projects done by Mindspace have resulted in several national and international awards and consistent features in architectural journals. Sanjay Mohe also regularly gives lectures in architectural schools across the country.

sources.snippet: Some of the top firms in the city include Mindspace Architects, Khosla Associates, and Biome Environmental Solutions. These firms have designed some of the most iconic structures in the city and are known for their innovative design concepts and sustainable architecture.

Architect Sanjay Mohe is a nice human being, so humble yet so meticulous in each of his works.
For potential clients, expect innovation and rich expertise without compromising quality.

Such a disappointment travelled so long just to hear they wont plan for houses. It seems they only under take big projects namely schools and offices . Called them prior that day still they dint tell me that they won't do houses
Prominent architects in India, their office located in heart of the city in hi tech city n they have excellent expertise in architectural experience to large projects

places.generalDescription: Nestled just 3.5 km from the bustling Bangalore City Railway Station, Vidhan Soudha stands as a magnificent testament to Karnataka's legislative power and architectural prowess. Located on Dr. Ambedkar Road at the northern edge of Cubbon Park, this iconic structure is not only the largest legislative building in India but also a must-visit for anyone exploring Bangalore.

sources.snippet: Vidhan Soudha is not only of extreme political importance to the city but is also one of the most prominent landmarks of Bangalore. This historical place in Bangalore cannot be undermined either. The building is a rich amalgamation of neo-Dravidian, British, Indio-Islamic and contemporary architecture.
sources.shortName: 10 Historical Places in Bangalore

places.name: Vidhan Soudha Legislative Assembly Bangalore

reviews.text:
Vidhan Soudha, located in Bangalore, serves as the seat of the Karnataka State Legislature and is a prominent example of neo-Dravidian architecture. Completed in 1956, this grand building symbolizes the legislative sovereignty of the people of Karnataka, reflecting a design that merges traditional Indian architectural styles with modern materials like granite, steel, and glass.
Architecturally, Vidhan Soudha is striking, characterized by its massive dimensions of 700 feet in length and 350 feet in width. It features a central wing that stands 112 feet tall and houses the Legislative Assembly Chamber. The entrance is marked by a grand staircase with 45 steps, leading to a foyer that offers access to the Assembly Chamber
The building's construction involved over 6,000 workers, including many artisans who contributed to its artistic details, utilizing granite sourced from nearby quarries.
Visitors often admire not only the external grandeur but also the historical significance of the structure, as it stands as a testament to the political evolution of Karnataka. The adjacent Attara Kacheri, which houses the Karnataka High Court, complements the architectural ensemble of this area, showcasing a blend of Gothic and Indo-Saracenic styles

Vidhan Soudha stands as a magnificent symbol of governance, housing the Legislative Assembly. Its stunning architecture draws visitors eager to explore the vibrant atmosphere that surrounds this iconic landmark. As people stroll around its grand exterior, they can't help but feel the rich history and energy that pulses through the area, making it a must-visit destination.

Vidhan Soudha is a truly impressive place. While its exterior is accessible to all, not everyone gets the chance to explore its interior. The architecture is captivating, and the historical significance adds to its allure. A visit is recommended for those interested in the cultural and architectural heritage, even if only to appreciate the exterior grandeur.

places.address: Cuban park legislative assembly, KG Halli, D' Souza Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India
